author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Southern Railway, Salem Division, had accomplished a new feat of constructing a foot over bridge (FOB) at Buddireddypatti railway station here between Morappur and Bommidi railway stations on Monday.

In a communication, the railway has stated that the FOB, that would normally take three days for completion was set up “in a record time of three hours”.

According to the Southern Railway, this feat was possible through use of pre-fabricated steel. The FOB is 6.5 meter-high from the track and is of three meter-width. The FOB, constructed at a cost of Rs.1 crore, has been a long demand of the residents.

Safety

With the FOB in place, the public may now safely cross the tracks without any risk of accidents.

Similarly, one more such foot over bridge is proposed to be erected in Samalpatti Railway Station between Thiurpattur and Morappur Railway Stations.
title: Buddireddypatti railway station gets new foot over bridge
